subject: Psychology
title: Decay Theory
description: A micro-lesson that makes Decay Theory usable.

hook.text: Leave a sandcastle on the beach and waves will erase it. Some scientists think memory fades the same way.

buildup.text: Decay theory says that memory traces weaken over time if they're not accessed or rehearsed.

discovery.text: The physical change in neurons ‚Äî the memory trace or engram ‚Äî may gradually degrade without use.

twist.text: But hypnosis and brain stimulation sometimes recover old memories, suggesting decay isn't the whole story.

climax.text: Decay may explain some forgetting, but retrieval failure and interference explain far more.

punchline.text: Memories may fade, but they rarely vanish entirely.

quiz.question: What does decay theory propose about forgetting?
options: Memory traces weaken over time without use
Memories are actively deleted by the brain
